text: I used Webflow for a blog 2 years ago, and the designer had to upload everything. Hopefully they've improved as a CMS

elements.text: I used Webflow for a blog 2 years ago, and the designer had to upload everything. Hopefully they've improved as a CMS

text:
Hi <@U01LCCTLT8T> I work for Shorthand, which is a competitor for more immersive / interactive content, but with a slightly different customer base than Rock Content. Other options are Vev (a bit more designer focused I think) and Ceros (enterprise). Foleon is also in this space, but I know less about their niche.

I think most of the other tools you could use are aimed more at designers and developers, and would depend on your internal resources and workflows.

I run our own content program using Shorthand and can let you know our process. It basically involves thinking / planning more visually during the writing process, having a sense of how visually ambitious you want each piece to be, and knowing how that will impact your publishing cadence.

elements.text:

I run our own content program using Shorthand and can let you know our process. It basically involves thinking / planning more visually during the writing process, having a sense of how visually ambitious you want each piece to be, and knowing how that will impact your publishing cadence.
